tool_description: Determines optimal locations for transit stops based on accessibility, demand density, infrastructure constraints, and walking distance optimization.

candidate_locations.description: Flattened array of potential stop coordinates [lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2, ...]

population_density_data.description: Path to population density raster or point data

employment_centers.description: Coordinates of major employment centers [lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2, ...]

max_walking_distance.description: Maximum acceptable walking distance to stops in meters (200-1200)

infrastructure_constraints.description: List of constraint types (road_width, utilities, zoning, terrain)

demand_weight.description: Weight for demand coverage in optimization (0-1)

minimum_stop_spacing.description: Minimum distance between stops in meters (150-800)

budget_constraint.description: Maximum number of stops that can be built

error_messages: Invalid coordinate format: candidate_locations must be flattened array of [lat, lon] pairs with even number of elements.
Population data not accessible: Check that population_density_data path exists and format is supported.
Invalid walking distance: max_walking_distance must be between 200-1200 meters.
Weight constraint violation: accessibility_weight + demand_weight must equal 1.0.
Invalid stop spacing: minimum_stop_spacing must be between 150-800 meters.
Insufficient candidate locations: Provide at least 2 candidate stop locations.
usage: Provide candidate stop coordinates and population data. Set optimization weights and constraints. Tool returns ranked optimal stop locations with accessibility metrics.

optimal_stops.description: Coordinates of selected optimal stop locations [lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2, ...]

accessibility_scores.description: Accessibility score (0-100) for each selected stop

coverage_percentage.description: Percentage of target area covered within walking distance

total_served_population.description: Estimated population served by the optimized stop network
